byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and STEPHEN CASTLE

abstract: European leaders hold summit meeting to grapple directly with crisis of Greece's debt, beleaguered banks and bailout fund; strike deal to recapitalize banking sector, but give no definitive answer on how they will expand or guarantee the euro zone's rescue fund.
snippet: Leaders hope the seriousness of their effort to solve the problems of Greek debt, weak banks and a bailout fund in need of reinforcement will ease the markets on Monday.
lead_paragraph: Leaders hope the seriousness of their effort to solve the problems of Greek debt, weak banks and a bailout fund in need of reinforcement will ease the markets on Monday.

headline.main: European Leaders Deal Directly With Debt Dilemma
headline.print_headline: European Leaders Confront Basics of Debt Dilemma
headline.seo: Leaders Say Progress Made in Dealing With Euro Crisis
